channel.title: Function Pointer Basics :: CIS 308 Textbook
channel.description: Declaration Syntax Here is the syntax for declaring a function pointer: return_type (*ptr_name) (args);This declares ptr_name as a pointer to a function that returns something of type return_type and that takes the argument types described in args. Here, args is a comma-separated lists of the argument types for a function. For example, args would be (int, double) for a function that took two arguments â€“ an int followed by a double.
